title: Part (a)(i)
stimulusHtml: Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify one environmental impact of dead zones, such as:

· Decrease in overall diversity in area

· Disproportionate loss of benthic/bottom-dwelling species

· Loss of habitat area

· Increase in disease in aquatic organisms as a result of stress

· Reduction in dissolved oxygen

Die-off of fish and other aquatic organisms

The response identifies one environmental impact of dead zones, such as:

· Decrease in overall diversity in area

· Disproportionate loss of benthic/bottom-dwelling species

· Loss of habitat area

· Increase in disease in aquatic organisms as a result of stress

· Reduction in dissolved oxygen

Die-off of fish and other aquatic organisms

title: Part (a)(ii)
stimulusHtml: Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe how thermal pollution from power plant discharge would affect the frequency of dead zones.

Warmer water cannot hold as much dissolved oxygen as cold water can hold, which would increase the number of hypoxic zones/dead zones.

The response describes how thermal pollution from power plant discharge would affect the frequency of dead zones.

Warmer water cannot hold as much dissolved oxygen as cold water can hold, which would increase the number of hypoxic zones/dead zones.

title: Part (a)(iii)
stimulusHtml:
Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.

The response does not earn credit for identifying excess nutrients or thermal pollution.
descriptions:
The response does not identify one other nonpoint source pollutant of aquatic environments, such as:

· Oil runoff/oil spills

· Sediment in water from erosions/sediment runoff from agricultural areas or forested areas

· Heavy metal runoff from energy production/urban areas

· Toxic chemical runoff/pesticide runoff from agriculture and/or residential areas

· Salt runoff from irrigation practices

· Pharmaceutical pollution from sewages/feedlots

· Stormwater runoff from urban areas/road surfaces

· Bacteria/sewage runoff from livestock, pet wastes, faulty septic systems

The response identifies one other nonpoint source pollutant of aquatic environments, such as:

· Oil runoff/oil spills

· Sediment in water from erosions/sediment runoff from agricultural areas or forested areas

· Heavy metal runoff from energy production/urban areas

· Toxic chemical runoff/pesticide runoff from agriculture and/or residential areas

· Salt runoff from irrigation practices

· Pharmaceutical pollution from sewages/feedlots

· Stormwater runoff from urban areas/road surfaces

· Bacteria/sewage runoff from livestock, pet wastes, faulty septic systems

title: (a)(iv)
stimulusHtml:
Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.

The response does not need to be linked to the nonpoint source pollutant identified in part (a)(iii).
descriptions: The response does not propose a solution to reduce the amount of nonpoint source pollutants in aquatic environments.
The response proposes a solution to reduce the amount of nonpoint source pollutants in aquatic environments.

stimulusHtml:
Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.

The students must show their work for full credit. Students do not need to include units in the setup.
